wikipedia_page.main: Paul Powell (born 30 June 1978) is an English former professional footballer. He played as a midfielder, making nearly 180 league appearances for Oxford United between 1994 and 2003.

response: The stadium is officially owned by one of Kassam's Firoka Group companies, and hosted its first football match on 4 August 2001. The game was a friendly match against Crystal Palace, which Oxford won on penalties following a 1–1 draw, and Paul Powell scored the club's first goal at the ground. The first competitive match at the ground took place one week later, on 11 August, against Rochdale, in the Football League Third Division (now Football League Two). United lost this match 2–1 in front of a crowd of 7,842 people; Jamie Brooks scored for Oxford. Since then, the ground has hosted rugby union games, as well as an under-17 International football tournament in 2002.
* Paul Powell (minister) (?–2016), dean of Baylor University's George W. Truett Theological Seminary
* Paul Powell (politician) (1902–1970), Illinois Secretary of State in the 1960s
